findings.metric: Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome
findings.interpretation: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination was associated with broader tumor antigen display in the immunopeptidome.

findings.metric: Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome
findings.interpretation: The MHC-I-presented peptide landscape expanded substantially after intratumoral mRNA vaccination.

findings.metric: Retrospective human survival comparison p-value under ICI treatment
findings.comparator_or_baseline: Not applicable (single p-value for vaccinated vs unvaccinated comparison)
findings.interpretation: In the retrospective metastatic cohort, vaccinated status was associated with improved survival under ICI treatment.

findings.metric: Type I interferon response score (normalized units)
findings.interpretation: mRNA vaccination markedly induced a type I interferon response in tumors relative to baseline.

findings.metric: PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue
findings.interpretation: After mRNA vaccination, the PD-L1 axis increased in tumor tissue, consistent with greater targetability for checkpoint blockade.
Combination treatment was associated with increased CD8+ T-cell infiltration relative to baseline.

controls_or_null_results.statement: Vaccine-only treatment did not produce durable tumor control in non-immunogenic models.
Lipid particle controls lacking mRNA did not reproduce the sensitization effect.
Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.
